supporting_quotes: From 1966 to 1969, she worked as a physician at the Directorate of Health (Helsedirektoratet),
events.notes: Worked as a physician at the Directorate of Health

supporting_quotes: Educated as a physician, Brundtland joined the Labour Party and entered the government in 1974 as Minister of the Environment.
events.notes: Served as Minister of the Environment in the Labour Party government

supporting_quotes: Brundtland became leader of the Labour Party in 1981 and held the office until resigning in 1992, during her third term as prime minister.
events.notes: Led the Labour Party while serving multiple terms as Prime Minister

events.canonical_org_name: Brundtland Commission (World Commission on Environment and Development)
supporting_quotes: In 1983, Brundtland was invited by then United Nations Secretary-General Javier Pérez de Cuéllar to establish and chair the World Commission on Environment and Development (WCED), widely referred to as the Brundtland Commission.
events.notes: Chaired the Brundtland Commission established by the UN

supporting_quotes: After the end of her term as PM, Brundtland was then elected Director-General of the World Health Organization in May 1998.
Director-General of the World Health Organization 1998–2003
events.notes: Served as Director-General of WHO after her premiership

supporting_quotes: Brundtland was recognized in 2003 by Scientific American as their 'Policy Leader of the Year' for coordinating a rapid worldwide response to stem outbreaks of SARS.
events.notes: Received Policy Leader of the Year award from Scientific American

roles: UN Special Envoy for Climate Change
supporting_quotes: In May 2007, UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon named Brundtland, as well as Ricardo Lagos (the former president of Chile), and Han Seung-soo (the former foreign minister of South Korea), to serve as UN Special Envoys for Climate Change.
and served as director-general of the World Health Organization and as UN special envoy on Climate Change from 2007 to 2010.
events.notes: Served as UN Special Envoy for Climate Change

supporting_quotes: She was appointed Deputy Chair of the group in 2013 and was succeeded in this role by Ban Ki-moon and Graça Machel in 2018.
events.notes: Served as Deputy Chair of The Elders organization
